titles.title: Main Street Input Opportunity Act of 2016
To amend title 5, United States Code, to require that the Department of Labor be a covered agency for purposes of regulatory flexibility analyses, and for other purposes.
Main Street Input Opportunity Act of 2016

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Small Business, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Small Business, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Regulatory Reform, Commercial And Antitrust Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Administrative State, Regulatory Reform, and Antitrust

bill.summary:
Main Street Input Opportunity Act of 2016
This bill includes the Department of Labor as a "covered agency" for purposes of regulatory flexibility analysis provisions.
